aptitude_reasoning.q: A train 180 m long is running at a speed of 54 km/hr. In what time will it cross a platform 120 m long?
A person walks 20% slower than usual. He reaches office 10 minutes late. What is the usual time taken to reach the office?
A can do a work in 18 days and B in 27 days. They work together for 6 days. How much work is left?
If an item is sold at a 25% profit, and the selling price is ₹500, what is the cost price?
The sum of ages of A and B is 50. Five years ago, A was twice as old as B. What is the age of B now?
Pipe A can fill a tank in 20 minutes, Pipe B in 30 minutes. If both are opened together but B is closed after 10 minutes, how long will it take to fill the tank?
A card is drawn from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards. What is the probability of getting a red queen?

personality_big5.q: I enjoy exploring new tools or workflows, even if it means extra effort initially.
I make detailed task checklists and rarely miss deadlines.
During team meetings, I actively contribute and initiate discussions.
If a teammate is struggling with a deadline, I proactively offer help.
When I receive unexpected negative feedback, I find it difficult to stay calm and focused.
Before finalizing a project, I review all inputs carefully to maintain quality.
I adapt quickly when project goals shift or when learning new tools.

work_values_motivation.q: I feel most productive when I can decide how and when to complete my tasks.
I set challenging personal goals at work and take pride in reaching them.
I feel fulfilled when I contribute to a team’s collective success.
Getting appreciated for my contributions significantly boosts my motivation.
I prefer jobs that allow me to contribute to causes I care about.
I am motivated by opportunities for recognition and respect.
I value stability and security in my work environment.

emotional_intelligence.q: I can usually identify what emotion I’m feeling in stressful situations.
I naturally sense when a colleague is feeling down, even without being told.
I remain composed when deadlines shift or unexpected problems arise.
I make efforts to resolve misunderstandings before they escalate.
Even after setbacks, I maintain momentum and keep working toward my goal.
I listen carefully to understand others’ perspectives before responding.
I adjust my communication style depending on who I’m speaking with.

career_adaptability.q: When faced with unexpected project changes, I quickly reassess priorities and adjust.
I actively seek out opportunities to develop skills beyond my current role.
I feel confident exploring roles that are different from what I’ve done before.
I often reflect on how future industry changes might affect my career path.
When responsibilities shift, I focus on learning instead of resisting change.
I regularly research new tools and technologies relevant to my field.
I can visualize multiple backup plans if my primary career goal doesn’t work out.

cognitive_thinking.q: You're leading a student tech fest. Midway through the event, the chief guest cancels. What do you do?
You’re developing an AI project with 3 teammates. One insists on outdated methods. How do you persuade?
options: Present data for newer methods & ask feedback
Let them use their approach and compare later
cognitive_thinking.answer: Present data for newer methods & ask feedback

cognitive_thinking.q: During a campus interview, you’re asked a question you don’t know. What do you do?
options: Admit honestly & show eagerness to learn
cognitive_thinking.answer: Admit honestly & show eagerness to learn

cognitive_thinking.q: A teammate disagrees with your strategy in front of a professor. What do you prioritize?
You have 2 job offers: one high-paying but stressful, the other low-paying but passion-driven. Which do you pick?
Slides fail during seminar & script is lost. How do you manage?
You’re assigned a domain you don’t know but expected to lead. What’s your action?
options: Learn as you go & ask support
